t: Psalm 109
To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
Hold*p not thy peace, O God of my praise;
For*p the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
They*p compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
For*p my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.
And*p they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
Set*p thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.
When*p he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.
Let*p his days be few; and let another take his office.
Let*p his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
Let*p his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
Let*p the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.
Let*p there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
Let*p his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
Let*p the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord;*s and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
Let*p them be before the Lord*s continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
Because*p that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.
As*p he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.
As*p he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
Let*p it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
Let*p this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord,*s and of them that speak evil against my soul.
But*p do thou for me, O God*s the Lord, for thy name's sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.
For*p I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
I*p am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
My*p knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.
I*p became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.
Help*p me, O Lord*s my God: O save me according to thy mercy:
That*p they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord,*s hast done it.
Let*p them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
Let*p mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.
I*p will greatly praise the Lord*s with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
For*p he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
